DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate change erectile function ( EF ) versus 8 bi-weekly treatment Low-Intensity Extracorporeal Shock Wave Therapy ( LIESWT ) via IIEF-EF ( Erectile Function domain International Index Erectile Function ) score .
DOC.brief_title: Low Frequency Shock Wave Therapy Improving Post-prostatectomy Erectile Dysfunction : Prospective Pilot Study
DOC.detailed_description: The secondary objective study evaluate change follow element versus 8 bi-weekly treatment LIESWT : A. EF categorical improvement . B . Other validated measure EF ( SEP2 ( question 2 sexual encounter profile ) , SEP3 ( question 3 sexual encounter profile ) , GAQ ( Global Assessment Question ) , EHS ( Erection Hardness Score ) ) , remain domain IIEF score ( orgasmic function , sexual desire , intercourse satisfaction , overall satisfaction ) , well total IIEF score . C. Harms/Safety : To evaluate treatment tolerance potential adverse event .
DOC.criteria: The patient give informed sign consent The patient must insure beneficiary health insurance plan The patient man least 18 year old less 80 year old The patient stable , sexual relationship one person least past three month The patient consult erectile dysfunction last 6 month The patient prostatectomy 18 60 month ago The patient erectile function domain score International Index Erectile Function questionnaire 6 25 The patient least natural tumescence sexual stimulation ( erection hardness score â‰¥ 1 ) The patient phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitor treatment month precede inclusion The patient available 8 month followup agrees participate study visit The patient participate another interventional study , participate another interventional study within past 3 month The patient exclusion period determine previous study The patient judicial protection , adult guardianship It impossible correctly inform patient , patient refuse sign consent Complete anerection Untreated testosterone deficiency Neurological disease Psychiatric disease Anatomical malformation penis Chronic haematological pathology significant clinical impact Oral injectable antiandrogen treatment The patient take blood thinner international normalized ratio > 3 History erectile dysfunction prostatectomy
